meanings.definition: State as a fact; assert strongly and publicly.
meanings.sent1: She was affirming her belief in the importance of kindness.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was affirming that the answer was correct.
meanings.sent3: He kept affirming his love for pizza, even when he was full.
meanings.sent4: The flowers blooming in the garden were affirming the arrival of spring.
meanings.sent5: The roaring applause from the audience was affirming the actor's talent.

meanings.sent1: The judge was affirming the legality of the contract.
meanings.sent2: Please affirm that you have read and understood the terms and conditions.
meanings.sent3: The magic mirror affirming that she was indeed the fairest of them all.
meanings.sent4: The handshake was affirming their agreement to the deal.
meanings.sent5: The signature on the document was affirming the decision to move forward.
